Articles.Content:
Well today whilst playing on the first save file I created for KSP, the Kraken struck. My Dres ship was catapulted out of the Kerbol system -and, according to the flight clock, about six months forward in time- directly after this the ship erased itself. The worried faces of the Kerbals on board as they vanished will haunt me forever. Then the save irretrievably crashed. I lost a munbase, a station and three interplanetary missions;.;.

Given that the latest update will break saves I'm not too torn up about this, but I feel I should do something to commemorate the brave Kerbal pioneers of space travel in another save. Any ideas?

Set the sky ON FIRE!

21 orange tank salute
When the Kraken eats the universe on you,
Flag on Dres, after the solar flare? Assuming the Kraken doesn't show up again.

Upon further investigation (and an attempt at the 21 mainsail salute) I discovered that 1) The Kraken destroyed all my saves-and new games-, not just the one. 2) 21 mainsails are an unstable mix.

Evidently the Kraken is a cross dimensional being. A worthy adversary! I shall send an expedition to Bop to exact revenge as soon as I've re-installed KSP.
What, precisely, is happening when you try to play or start a game?

21 orange tank salute

That or large SRBs. Something big, and flying in a few directions. Maybe have some kerbals standing in a line, showing their respects.

What, precisely, is happening when you try to play or start a game?

The sky is missing, so are the maps and large portions of the ground and it lags tremendously. Reinstalling appears to have fixed it so tomorrow I will pay my respects to the many Kerbal dead. May they never be forgotten...

2) 21 mainsails are an unstable mix.

I've gone as high as eighty, and the physics didn't freak out on me.

Edited July 15, 2013 by Whackjob
Shock and Awe. Build an indestructible fleet, send it to Bop, land an army of kerbals around the Kraken corpse, and dare it to strike again.

21 SRB Salute is less complicated IMO, especially the small ones.

I've gone as high as eighty, and the physics didn't freak out on me.

A very powerful computer you must have.
Build a planet-destroyer probe and slam it into Bop. What's better way to show your contempt to stupid cephalopod?

Attempted the 21 SRB salute. Went off in typical Kerbal fashion.

It started well...

But things went bad...

Now we need to salute those killed today
